name: Latisys
tag_list: data-center, datacenter, cloud, hosting, managed-services, it-outsourcing, servers, it
overview:
With a heritage serving business customers since 1994, Latisys is quickly becoming the hosting provider of choice for companies looking to achieve a better return on their IT infrastructure investment.

Latisys was founded in June, 2007 by three highly experienced industry executives and in conjunction with Great Hill Partners and Catalyst Investors – with a mission to deliver industry-leading colocation, managed hosting, managed services, cloud and disaster recovery solutions to small-, medium- and enterprise-class businesses alike.

Today, with high-density Tier III data centers located in all four U.S. time zones, Latisys customers not only receive local solutions to reduce their own capital expenditures for storage and ongoing maintenance, but a national reach for safe and secure managed backup and disaster recovery solutions.

Plus, Latisys offers business customers flexible ITO infrastructure solutions to help them take the next step in their growth plan

  • IT Off-site Solutions for companies who still want full hands-on control of their IT equipment, but want the benefits of a secure, redundant and highly available data center facility for their IT equipment
  • IT Off-load Solutions for companies looking to free up their limited staff from routine IT maintenance tasks so they can spend more time focusing on growing their business
  • IT Outsource Solutions that allow companies to leverage state-of-the-art technologies and hardware innovations without incurring capital expenses
  • IT Optimize Solutions for customers who are looking to maximize the performance, scalability and overall value of their IT infrastructure

Latisys’ SAS 70 Type II Compliant facilities are located in Irvine, CA (formerly InteleNet), Denver, CO (formerly Data393), Chicago, IL (formerly Stargate) and Ashburn, VA.

milestones.description: Completed new state-of-the-art data center in Denver, CO
milestones.source_description: Latisys Expands National IaaS Platform with Second Data Center in Denver
